intro: Bihai burchellii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branched. Bihai burchellii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
